result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

ADDRESS INFO for William D Campbell
Current: 629 W. Milwaukee St. #3, Jefferson, WI 53549 United States  (Effective: 01-19-2016)
Prior: 614 W. Plymouth Apt #6, Jefferson, WI 53549 United States

Cases 15CM288 & 15CM304 called together at 9:38 am [Clerk SH]
Defendant William D Campbell in court with Attorney Karl Huebner. ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court clarifies that It only calls case 15CM304 for reference as it was read-in and dismissed; Atty Huebner confirms that restitution has been paid
Sentencing arguments by Counsel; ADA Hall submits victim impact statement


Court sentences the Defendant to pay costs of = $243 + $200 DNA Surcharge = $443, within 90 days. Non-payment results in a 9 day jail term, with Huber privileges consecutive.
To submit a DNA Sample
Recess: 9:43 am

Cases 15CM288 & 15CM304 called together at 3:01 pm [Clerk SH] (Case was scheduled for FSSC)
Defendant William D Campbell in court with Attorney Karl Huebner. ADA Jeffrey Martin Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Huebner informs the Court that they will be requesting to set out sentencing to attempt to accept alternate offer and attempt to pay restitution

Constitutional rights given; plea of "No Contest" entered; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders JOC entered.
On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Case 15CM304
Court reminds Mr. Campbell that his bond/conditions of release remain in effect

Recess: 3:08 pm 

NEXT:  15CM288 (1) Schedule Sentencing Hearing 1/19/16 at 8:30 am - Send notices

Jury trial at 12-07-2015 08:30 am

Scheduling Notice

Cases 15CM370 & 15CM288 called together at 1:36 pm [Clerk SH]
[Reserve Judge Robert Mawdsley presiding for BrIV]
Defendant William D Campbell in court with Attorney Karl Huebner. DA Susan Victoria Happ appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hueber requests that both matters be set on the trial calendar
DA Happ: Suggests setting matters on same date/time and then choosing which would proceed at FSSC date

Counsel agree that the matters should be heard separately and should only take one day each
Court reminds Mr. Campbell that his bond, conditions of release remain in effect while the cases are pending
